Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Universality \U`ni*ver*sal"i*ty\, n.; pl. {Universalties}. [Cf. F. universalit['e].] The quality or state of being universal; unlimited extension or application; generality; -- distinguished from particularity; as, the unversality of a proposition; the unversality of sin; the unversality of the Deluge. [1913 Webster]
universality n : the quality of being universal; existing everywhere [syn: {catholicity}]
